foundVulnerability.title: Microsoft Windows Server 2003 End of Life
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Support has ended for Windows Server 2003. This host should be immediately upgraded.
foundVulnerability.solution: If this host is required for production, please upgrade the operating system and ensure it is fully patched.

foundVulnerability.title: Microsoft Windows Server 2003 End of Life
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Support has ended for Windows Server 2003. This host should be immediately upgraded.
foundVulnerability.solution: If this host is required for production, please upgrade the operating system and ensure it is fully patched.

foundVulnerability.title: Microsoft Windows Tilde Character File Name Information Disclosure
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Requesting /*~1*/.aspx resulted in a 404 not found. This indicates a file or folder is present. Requesting a known non-existant file/folder resulted in a 400 bad request. This indicates the IIS server is vulnerable.
foundVulnerability.solution: Ensure the web server only serves files it is specifically meant to serve. Backup data and other sensitive files should be protected if their contents are meant to be kept confidential. Also, Microsoft has released information on how to disable the OS's ability to create the shortened names. See the link in the vulnerability references section for more details.

foundVulnerability.title: Microsoft Windows Server 2003 End of Life
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Support has ended for Windows Server 2003. This host should be immediately upgraded.
foundVulnerability.solution: If this host is required for production, please upgrade the operating system and ensure it is fully patched.

foundVulnerability.title: TLS Connection: TLS Version 1.0 Enabled
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Server supports TLS version 1.0
foundVulnerability.solution: Due to its inherent weaknesses, please consider disabling support for TLSv1.0 and only supporting newer protocols such as TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. Consult your specific vendor documentation for more information.

foundVulnerability.title: SSL Connection: SSLv3 CBC Mode Cipher POODLE Vulnerability
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Server's highest supported protocol: TLSv1 Reconnected using a lower client protocol: SSLv3
foundVulnerability.solution: It is recommended that SSL 3.0 be disabled to avoid this and other related vulnerabilities. However, due to backwards compatibility concerns, it may be necessary to leave this protocol enabled. In this case disabling CBC ciphers will also prevent this attack. It is also recommended that the client and server be updated to support the TLS_FALLBACK_SCSV mechanism. This ensures that SSL 3.0 is only used in legacy situations, and prevents attackers from forcing a protocol downgrade.

foundVulnerability.title: SSL Connection: Session Resume Cipher Downgrade Vulnerability
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Successfully changed ciphers from AES256-SHA to DES-CBC-SHA during a session resume
foundVulnerability.solution:
For OpenSSL, upgrade to version 0.9.8q or later for 0.9.x series OpenSSL servers or 1.0.1g for 1.0.x series OpenSSL servers to remediate this issue. For specific upgrade instructions, please consult OpenSSL's website. If OpenSSL was bundled in a third party application or device, contact the third party vendor for specific remediation instructions.
For Microsoft's SChannel, ensure that all lower strength ciphers have been disabled.
For all other SSL implementations, pelase refer to vendor documentation concerning SSL cipher suite configurations.

foundVulnerability.title: SSL Connection: Session Resume Cipher Downgrade Vulnerability
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Successfully changed ciphers from AES256-SHA to DES-CBC-SHA during a session resume
foundVulnerability.solution:
For OpenSSL, upgrade to version 0.9.8q or later for 0.9.x series OpenSSL servers or 1.0.1g for 1.0.x series OpenSSL servers to remediate this issue. For specific upgrade instructions, please consult OpenSSL's website. If OpenSSL was bundled in a third party application or device, contact the third party vendor for specific remediation instructions.
For Microsoft's SChannel, ensure that all lower strength ciphers have been disabled.
For all other SSL implementations, pelase refer to vendor documentation concerning SSL cipher suite configurations.

foundVulnerability.title: SSL Connection: SSLv3 CBC Mode Cipher POODLE Vulnerability
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Server's highest supported protocol: TLSv12 Reconnected using a lower client protocol: TLSv11
foundVulnerability.solution: It is recommended that SSL 3.0 be disabled to avoid this and other related vulnerabilities. However, due to backwards compatibility concerns, it may be necessary to leave this protocol enabled. In this case disabling CBC ciphers will also prevent this attack. It is also recommended that the client and server be updated to support the TLS_FALLBACK_SCSV mechanism. This ensures that SSL 3.0 is only used in legacy situations, and prevents attackers from forcing a protocol downgrade.

foundVulnerability.title: SSL Connection: SSLv3 CBC Mode Cipher POODLE Vulnerability
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Server's highest supported protocol: TLSv1 Reconnected using a lower client protocol: SSLv3
foundVulnerability.solution: It is recommended that SSL 3.0 be disabled to avoid this and other related vulnerabilities. However, due to backwards compatibility concerns, it may be necessary to leave this protocol enabled. In this case disabling CBC ciphers will also prevent this attack. It is also recommended that the client and server be updated to support the TLS_FALLBACK_SCSV mechanism. foundVulnerability.title: TLS Connection: TLS Version 1.0 Enabled
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Server supports TLS version 1.0

foundVulnerability.title: SSL Connection: Server Appears Vulnerable to ChangeCipherSpec Injection
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Host does not reject early change cipher spec using TLSv1
foundVulnerability.solution:
This vulnerability is reported to affect versions of OpenSSL including:
OpenSSL 1.0.1 through 1.0.1g OpenSSL 1.0.0 through 1.0.0l all versions before OpenSSL 0.9.8y
Non-affected versions include: OpenSSL 1.0.1h OpenSSL 1.0.0m OpenSSL 0.9.8za
OpenSSL has released updated versions of the library that address this vulnerability. Please upgrade to the latest version.

foundVulnerability.title: Insecure HTML5 Cross Origin Request Policy
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Insecure HTML5 Cross Origin Request Policy: 204.76.30.160:443: /content/
foundVulnerability.solution: Please limit cross-domain access to evaluated and specified sites.

foundVulnerability.vulnData: Server supports TLS version 1.0

foundVulnerability.vulnData: Server supports TLS version 1.0
foundVulnerability.solution: Due to its inherent weaknesses, please consider disabling support for TLSv1.0 and only supporting newer protocols such as TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. Consult your specific vendor documentation for more information.

foundVulnerability.title: Slowloris Resource Depletion And Denial Of Service
foundVulnerability.vulnData: The webserver appears to be vulnerable to a resource exhaustion attack.
foundVulnerability.solution:
This attack can be mitigated by; 1) limiting the number of inactive concurrent web server connections a single user may be allowed to maintain, or 2) setting a minimum threshold of data per second a web server connection is allowed to maintain without being dropped.
Examples of applicable apache modules useful for implementing suggested remediation include: mod_reqtimeout - http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/mod_reqtimeout.html mod_qos - http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-qos/ mod_cband - http://cband.linux.pl mod_limitpconn - http://dominia.org/djao/limitipconn.html mod_evasive - http://www.networkdweebs.com/stuff/security.html mod_security - http://www.modsecurity.org/ mod_antiloris - ftp://ftp.monshouwer.eu/pub/linux/mod_antiloris/
Additional third party modules may also be available. Please contact the vendor for additional information.

foundVulnerability.title: Slowloris Resource Depletion And Denial Of Service

foundVulnerability.title: SSL Connection: TLS CBC Mode Cipher POODLE Vulnerability
foundVulnerability.vulnData: server accepts bad padding: HTTP/1.1 302 Found
foundVulnerability.solution:
This vulnerability typically impacts network devices, such as F5 and A10 devices, which are often placed as SSL termination points in front of company assets. Affected vendors have released patches for this flaw which once installed, should remediate the vulnerability.
Please see the references list for more information.

foundVulnerability.title: SSL Certificate: Wrong Hostname, Does Not Match Domain Name
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Certificate Hostname: vpn.aflac.com does not resolve to ip: 204.76.30.229 Certificate Subject Alternative Names: vpn.aflac.com, pcnvpnseccs02a.hq.aflac.com, pcnvpnseccs02b.hq.aflac.com do not resolve to ip: 204.76.30.229
foundVulnerability.solution: Please contact the Certificate Authority which issued this SSL certificate to obtain a certificate with an updated domain name.

foundVulnerability.title: OpenSSH Connection Slot Exhaustion Denial of Service
foundVulnerability.vulnData: openssh 6.0
foundVulnerability.solution: Please refer to the External References section for links to supplemental vulnerability information and remediation details.

foundVulnerability.title: SSH Connection: CBC Mode Ciphers Enabled
foundVulnerability.vulnData:
Client to Server Encryption Algorithms: aes128-cbc 3des-cbc blowfish-cbc cast128-cbc aes192-cbc aes256-cbc rijndael-cbc@lysator.liu.se
Server to Client Encryption Algorithms: aes128-cbc 3des-cbc blowfish-cbc cast128-cbc aes192-cbc aes256-cbc rijndael-cbc@lysator.liu.se
foundVulnerability.solution: Disable CBC mode ciphers listed in the vulnerability data section for this SSH server and enable Counter (CTR) or Galois/Counter (GCM) mode ciphers instead, this can usually be done in the SSH config file. For more specific remediation instructions, refer to the product's documentation or contact the vendor for support.

foundVulnerability.title: SSH Connection: Supports RC4 Cipher
foundVulnerability.vulnData:
Client to Server Encryption Algorithms: arcfour256 arcfour128 arcfour
Server to Client Encryption Algorithms: arcfour256 arcfour128 arcfour
foundVulnerability.solution: Disable the RC4 (arcfour) ciphers listed in the vulnerability data section for this SSH server, this can usually be done in the SSH config file. For more specific remediation instructions, refer to the product's documentation or contact the vendor for support.

foundVulnerability.title: SSH Connection: Weak MAC Algorithms Enabled
foundVulnerability.vulnData:
Client to Server MAC Algorithms: hmac-md5 hmac-sha2-256-96 hmac-sha2-512-96 hmac-sha1-96 hmac-md5-96
Server to Client MAC Algorithms: hmac-md5 hmac-sha2-256-96 hmac-sha2-512-96 hmac-sha1-96 hmac-md5-96
foundVulnerability.solution: Disable any MD5 or 96-bit MAC algorithms listed in the vulnerability data section for this SSH server, this can usually be done in the SSH config file. For more specific remediation instructions, refer to the product's documentation or contact the vendor for support.

foundVulnerability.title: HTTP Slow POST Resource Depletion And Denial Of Service
foundVulnerability.vulnData: The webserver appears to be vulnerable to a resource exhaustion attack: 40 slow post requests of 40 were successfully performed averaging 242 seconds per slow post with 120 seconds in between each partial chunk.
foundVulnerability.solution:
The mitigation for the slow post attack is similar to that of the slowloris attack (aka slow headers). The slow post attack can be mitigated by; 1) setting absolute receive timeouts for both the header and the body of a message, and 2) setting a minimum threshold of data per second a web server connection is allowed to maintain without being dropped.
Examples of applicable apache modules useful for implementing suggested remediation include: mod_reqtimeout - http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/mod_reqtimeout.html mod_qos - http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-qos/ mod_cband - http://cband.linux.pl mod_limitpconn - http://dominia.org/djao/limitipconn.html mod_evasive - http://www.networkdweebs.com/stuff/security.html mod_security - http://www.modsecurity.org/
Additional third party modules may also be available. Please contact the vendor for additional information.

foundVulnerability.title: HTTP Slow POST Resource Depletion And Denial Of Service
foundVulnerability.vulnData: The webserver appears to be vulnerable to a resource exhaustion attack: 40 slow post requests of 40 were successfully performed averaging 240 seconds per slow post with 120 seconds in between each partial chunk.
foundVulnerability.solution:
The mitigation for the slow post attack is similar to that of the slowloris attack (aka slow headers). The slow post attack can be mitigated by; 1) setting absolute receive timeouts for both the header and the body of a message, and 2) setting a minimum threshold of data per second a web server connection is allowed to maintain without being dropped.
Examples of applicable apache modules useful for implementing suggested remediation include: mod_reqtimeout - http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/mod_reqtimeout.html mod_qos - http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-qos/ mod_cband - http://cband.linux.pl mod_limitpconn - http://dominia.org/djao/limitipconn.html mod_evasive - http://www.networkdweebs.com/stuff/security.html mod_security - http://www.modsecurity.org/
Additional third party modules may also be available. Please contact the vendor for additional information.

foundVulnerability.title: Slowloris Resource Depletion And Denial Of Service
foundVulnerability.vulnData: The webserver appears to be vulnerable to a resource exhaustion attack: 40 requests held open for 16 seconds each resulted in 40 valid responses.
foundVulnerability.solution:
This attack can be mitigated by; 1) limiting the number of inactive concurrent web server connections a single user may be allowed to maintain, or 2) setting a minimum threshold of data per second a web server connection is allowed to maintain without being dropped.
Examples of applicable apache modules useful for implementing suggested remediation include: mod_reqtimeout - http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/mod_reqtimeout.html mod_qos - http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-qos/ mod_cband - http://cband.linux.pl mod_limitpconn - http://dominia.org/djao/limitipconn.html mod_evasive - http://www.networkdweebs.com/stuff/security.html mod_security - http://www.modsecurity.org/ mod_antiloris - ftp://ftp.monshouwer.eu/pub/linux/mod_antiloris/
Additional third party modules may also be available. Please contact the vendor for additional information.

foundVulnerability.title: Slowloris Resource Depletion And Denial Of Service
foundVulnerability.vulnData: The webserver appears to be vulnerable to a resource exhaustion attack: 40 requests held open for 16 seconds each resulted in 40 valid responses.
foundVulnerability.solution:
This attack can be mitigated by; 1) limiting the number of inactive concurrent web server connections a single user may be allowed to maintain, or 2) setting a minimum threshold of data per second a web server connection is allowed to maintain without being dropped.
Examples of applicable apache modules useful for implementing suggested remediation include: mod_reqtimeout - http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/mod_reqtimeout.html mod_qos - http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-qos/ mod_cband - http://cband.linux.pl mod_limitpconn - http://dominia.org/djao/limitipconn.html mod_evasive - http://www.networkdweebs.com/stuff/security.html mod_security - http://www.modsecurity.org/ mod_antiloris - ftp://ftp.monshouwer.eu/pub/linux/mod_antiloris/

foundVulnerability.title: Protocol Allows Authentication Over Clear Text
foundVulnerability.vulnData: imap allows transmission of credentials in clear text
foundVulnerability.solution:
Use an encrypted version of this service. The following table provides some examples of services which do authentication over clear text and their encrypted secure counterparts:
ftp -> sftp telnet -> ssh imap -> imaps pop3 -> pop3s

foundVulnerability.title: Protocol Allows Authentication Over Clear Text
foundVulnerability.vulnData: pop3 allows transmission of credentials in clear text
foundVulnerability.solution:

foundVulnerability.title: HTTP WWW-Authenticate Basic Over Plaintext HTTP
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Basic Auth URLs: 209.37.4.127:9080: /manager/html /manager/html;jsessionid=7B2A9F93484EE9AC073C2972C0F5F398?org.apache.catalina.filters.CSRF_NONCE=657CC161F693467D8FAAD8EC57FBD647 /manager/html?org.apache.catalina.filters.CSRF_NONCE=3E7DBC5C95DBAEA81E3BDF57EB9C277C /manager/status
foundVulnerability.solution: Ensure that this host is utilizing basic authentication over HTTPS. Alternatively, use digest authentication instead of basic authentication.

Examples of applicable apache modules useful for implementing suggested remediation include: mod_reqtimeout - http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/mod_reqtimeout.html mod_qos - http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-qos/ mod_cband - http://cband.linux.pl mod_limitpconn - http://dominia.org/djao/limitipconn.html mod_evasive - http://www.networkdweebs.com/stuff/security.html mod_security - http://www.modsecurity.org/

foundVulnerability.title: Slowloris Resource Depletion And Denial Of Service
foundVulnerability.vulnData: The webserver appears to be vulnerable to a resource exhaustion attack: 40 requests held open for 16 seconds each resulted in 40 valid responses.
foundVulnerability.solution:
This attack can be mitigated by; 1) limiting the number of inactive concurrent web server connections a single user may be allowed to maintain, or 2) setting a minimum threshold of data per second a web server connection is allowed to maintain without being dropped.
Examples of applicable apache modules useful for implementing suggested remediation include: mod_reqtimeout - http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/mod_reqtimeout.html mod_qos - http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-qos/ mod_cband - http://cband.linux.pl mod_limitpconn - http://dominia.org/djao/limitipconn.html mod_evasive - http://www.networkdweebs.com/stuff/security.html mod_security - http://www.modsecurity.org/ mod_antiloris - ftp://ftp.monshouwer.eu/pub/linux/mod_antiloris/
Additional third party modules may also be available. Please contact the vendor for additional information.

foundVulnerability.title: Slowloris Resource Depletion And Denial Of Service
foundVulnerability.vulnData: The webserver appears to be vulnerable to a resource exhaustion attack: 40 requests held open for 16 seconds each resulted in 40 valid responses.
foundVulnerability.solution:
This attack can be mitigated by; 1) limiting the number of inactive concurrent web server connections a single user may be allowed to maintain, or 2) setting a minimum threshold of data per second a web server connection is allowed to maintain without being dropped.
Examples of applicable apache modules useful for implementing suggested remediation include: mod_reqtimeout - http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/mod_reqtimeout.html mod_qos - http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-qos/ mod_cband - http://cband.linux.pl mod_limitpconn - http://dominia.org/djao/limitipconn.html mod_evasive - http://www.networkdweebs.com/stuff/security.html mod_security - http://www.modsecurity.org/ mod_antiloris - ftp://ftp.monshouwer.eu/pub/linux/mod_antiloris/
Additional third party modules may also be available. Please contact the vendor for additional information.

foundVulnerability.title: TLS Connection: TLS Version 1.0 Enabled
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Server supports TLS version 1.0
foundVulnerability.solution: Due to its inherent weaknesses, please consider disabling support for TLSv1.0 and only supporting newer protocols such as TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. Consult your specific vendor documentation for more information.

foundVulnerability.title: HTTP Slow POST Resource Depletion And Denial Of Service
foundVulnerability.vulnData: The webserver appears to be vulnerable to a resource exhaustion attack: 40 slow post requests of 40 were successfully performed averaging 241 seconds per slow post with 120 seconds in between each partial chunk.
foundVulnerability.solution:
The mitigation for the slow post attack is similar to that of the slowloris attack (aka slow headers). The slow post attack can be mitigated by; 1) setting absolute receive timeouts for both the header and the body of a message, and 2) setting a minimum threshold of data per second a web server connection is allowed to maintain without being dropped.
Examples of applicable apache modules useful for implementing suggested remediation include: mod_reqtimeout - http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/mod_reqtimeout.html mod_qos - http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-qos/ mod_cband - http://cband.linux.pl mod_limitpconn - http://dominia.org/djao/limitipconn.html mod_evasive - http://www.networkdweebs.com/stuff/security.html mod_security - http://www.modsecurity.org/
Additional third party modules may also be available. Please contact the vendor for additional information.

foundVulnerability.title: HTTP Slow POST Resource Depletion And Denial Of Service
foundVulnerability.vulnData: The webserver appears to be vulnerable to a resource exhaustion attack: 40 slow post requests of 40 were successfully performed averaging 240 seconds per slow post with 120 seconds in between each partial chunk.
foundVulnerability.solution:
The mitigation for the slow post attack is similar to that of the slowloris attack (aka slow headers). The slow post attack can be mitigated by; 1) setting absolute receive timeouts for both the header and the body of a message, and 2) setting a minimum threshold of data per second a web server connection is allowed to maintain without being dropped.
Examples of applicable apache modules useful for implementing suggested remediation include: mod_reqtimeout - http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/mod_reqtimeout.html mod_qos - http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-qos/ mod_cband - http://cband.linux.pl mod_limitpconn - http://dominia.org/djao/limitipconn.html mod_evasive - http://www.networkdweebs.com/stuff/security.html mod_security - http://www.modsecurity.org/

foundVulnerability.vulnData: Server supports TLS version 1.0
foundVulnerability.solution: Due to its inherent weaknesses, please consider disabling support for TLSv1.0 and only supporting newer protocols such as TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. Consult your specific vendor documentation for more information.

foundVulnerability.title: IPSec Aggressive Handshake And PSK
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Encryption Algorithm=3DES-CBC Hash Algorithm=MD5 Authentication Method=Unknown Group Description=Alternate 1024-bit MODP group Life-Type=Seconds Life-Duration=28800 Vendor  Mapped Vendor=Cisco Unity
foundVulnerability.solution: Discontinue use of Aggressive Mode with PSK. Alternative mitigation methods include Main Mode authentication or a token-based authentication scheme.

foundVulnerability.title: IPSec Weak Configuration
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Hash Algorithm=SHA
foundVulnerability.solution: Please ensure this host's IPSec service utilizes strong encryption algorithms, such as 3DES, AES, or stronger. SHA2 or stronger hashing algorithms should be utilized as well. Additionally, please ensure the minimum Diffie-Hellman exchange group is set to group 2 or greater.

foundVulnerability.title: Web Server Uses Unencrypted/Plaintext Form Password Fields

foundVulnerability.solution: Utilize HTTPS for all forms which post sensitive information to the web server.

foundVulnerability.title: IPSec Aggressive Handshake And PSK
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Encryption Algorithm=Unknown Hash Algorithm=SHA Authentication Method=Pre-shared key Group Description=Alternate 1024-bit MODP group Life-Type=Seconds Life-Duration= Vendor ID=7e31c9a88c03ba128a78bc680ff776ee9e3ca127d9558ec158a1e8e5ac0fb6799c0765b5412e095623802599666b125d2107eaa69c9a7455e139e392d54756caa5c5bb4149bb92b7130cd2c7b5e238adae7ff139468d37b78ff4c7b6101e2b17e313be2343b105c36848f7019c9b96b243f2541cf5288c91f02c49f722bfb5d6 Mapped Vendor=unknown Vendor ID=1e9aaea3d79fdf459658d10443be1341c821cadb Mapped Vendor=unknown Vendor ID=01110000cc4c1ebc Mapped Vendor=unknown Vendor ID=b9c93ee696153ed9b3c46b292f2be37a4fb89b90 Mapped Vendor=unknown Vendor ID=12f5f28c457168a9702d9fe274cc0100 Mapped Vendor=Cisco Unity Vendor ID=09002689dfd6b712 Mapped Vendor=unknown Vendor ID=afcad71368a1f1c96b8696fc77570100 Mapped Vendor=Dead Peer Detection v1.0 Vendor ID=4048b7d56ebce88525e7de7f00d6c2d3c0000000 Mapped Vendor=Cisco VPN Concentrator
foundVulnerability.solution: Discontinue use of Aggressive Mode with PSK. Alternative mitigation methods include Main Mode authentication or a token-based authentication scheme.

foundVulnerability.title: IPSec Weak Configuration
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Hash Algorithm=SHA
foundVulnerability.solution: Please ensure this host's IPSec service utilizes strong encryption algorithms, such as 3DES, AES, or stronger. SHA2 or stronger hashing algorithms should be utilized as well. Additionally, please ensure the minimum Diffie-Hellman exchange group is set to group 2 or greater.

foundVulnerability.title: SSH Connection: CBC Mode Ciphers Enabled
foundVulnerability.vulnData:
Client to Server Encryption Algorithms: aes128-cbc 3des-cbc blowfish-cbc cast128-cbc aes192-cbc aes256-cbc rijndael-cbc@lysator.liu.se
Server to Client Encryption Algorithms: aes128-cbc 3des-cbc blowfish-cbc cast128-cbc aes192-cbc aes256-cbc rijndael-cbc@lysator.liu.se
foundVulnerability.solution: Disable CBC mode ciphers listed in the vulnerability data section for this SSH server and enable Counter (CTR) or Galois/Counter (GCM) mode ciphers instead, this can usually be done in the SSH config file. For more specific remediation instructions, refer to the product's documentation or contact the vendor for support.

foundVulnerability.title: SSH Connection: Supports RC4 Cipher
foundVulnerability.vulnData:
Client to Server Encryption Algorithms: arcfour256 arcfour128 arcfour
Server to Client Encryption Algorithms: arcfour256 arcfour128 arcfour
foundVulnerability.solution: Disable the RC4 (arcfour) ciphers listed in the vulnerability data section for this SSH server, this can usually be done in the SSH config file. For more specific remediation instructions, refer to the product's documentation or contact the vendor for support.

foundVulnerability.title: SSH Connection: Weak MAC Algorithms Enabled
foundVulnerability.vulnData:
Client to Server MAC Algorithms: hmac-md5 hmac-sha2-256-96 hmac-sha2-512-96 hmac-sha1-96 hmac-md5-96
Server to Client MAC Algorithms: hmac-md5 hmac-sha2-256-96 hmac-sha2-512-96 hmac-sha1-96 hmac-md5-96
foundVulnerability.solution: Disable any MD5 or 96-bit MAC algorithms listed in the vulnerability data section for this SSH server, this can usually be done in the SSH config file. For more specific remediation instructions, refer to the product's documentation or contact the vendor for support.

foundVulnerability.title: Protocol Allows Authentication Over Clear Text
foundVulnerability.vulnData: smtp allows transmission of credentials in clear text
foundVulnerability.solution:
Use an encrypted version of this service. The following table provides some examples of services which do authentication over clear text and their encrypted secure counterparts:
ftp -> sftp telnet -> ssh imap -> imaps pop3 -> pop3s

foundVulnerability.title: SSL Certificate: Wrong Hostname, Does Not Match Domain Name
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Certificate Hostname: myrpm.aflac.com does not resolve to ip: 209.37.4.141 Certificate Subject Alternative Name: myrpm.aflac.com does not resolve to ip: 209.37.4.141
foundVulnerability.solution: Please contact the Certificate Authority which issued this SSL certificate to obtain a certificate with an updated domain name.

foundVulnerability.title: TLS Connection: TLS Version 1.0 Enabled
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Server supports TLS version 1.0
foundVulnerability.solution: Due to its inherent weaknesses, please consider disabling support for TLSv1.0 and only supporting newer protocols such as TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. Consult your specific vendor documentation for more information.

foundVulnerability.title: TLS Connection: TLS Version 1.0 Enabled
foundVulnerability.vulnData: Server supports TLS version 1.0
foundVulnerability.solution: Due to its inherent weaknesses, please consider disabling support for TLSv1.0 and only supporting newer protocols such as TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. Consult your specific vendor documentation for more information.

foundVulnerability.title: Slowloris Resource Depletion And Denial Of Service
foundVulnerability.vulnData: The webserver appears to be vulnerable to a resource exhaustion attack: 40 requests held open for 16 seconds each resulted in 40 valid responses.
foundVulnerability.solution:
This attack can be mitigated by; 1) limiting the number of inactive concurrent web server connections a single user may be allowed to maintain, or 2) setting a minimum threshold of data per second a web server connection is allowed to maintain without being dropped.
Examples of applicable apache modules useful for implementing suggested remediation include: mod_reqtimeout - http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/mod_reqtimeout.html mod_qos - http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-qos/ mod_cband - http://cband.linux.pl mod_limitpconn - http://dominia.org/djao/limitipconn.html mod_evasive - http://www.networkdweebs.com/stuff/security.html mod_security - http://www.modsecurity.org/ mod_antiloris - ftp://ftp.monshouwer.eu/pub/linux/mod_antiloris/
Additional third party modules may also be available. Please contact the vendor for additional information.
